block.p: U.S. Report Takes Issue With Entertainment Ads A Federal Trade Commission report will harshly criticize the entertainment industry for marketing strategies that entice young people to buy violent films, recordings and video games.

U.S. Report Takes Issue With Entertainment Ads A Federal Trade Commission report will harshly criticize the entertainment industry for marketing strategies that entice young people to buy violent films, recordings and video games.
Strike Ends at the Modern A strike by 250 employees at the Museum of Modern Art was settled with a five-year agreement.
Teenagers Behind Bars In 10 years, the number of teenagers in adult prisons has more than doubled. Jailed at 14, Jessica Robinson isn't getting counseling; she's learning from a murderer.

SPECIAL TODAY Fall Fancies For a taste of the exotic, visit colonial Antigua, Guatemala, or the ruins of Syria's dead cities. Or stay home and sip the wines of Washington state or wander Nantucket's historic streets.
The New Arts Season A three-part section previews theater, dance, television and radio, film, music, art, architecture and artifacts.
What About Health Care? It was a top political priority in 1992. Why not now?
